item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "But for sorrow there is no remedy provided by nature; it is often occasioned by accidents irreparable, and dwells upon objects that have lost or changed their existence; it requires what it cannot hope, that the laws of the universe should be repealed; that the dead should return or the past should be recalled." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Anne Enright
item.description: "People do not change, they are merely revealed." -- Anne Enright

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by a headstone in Ireland
item.description: "Death leaves a heartache no one can heal, love leaves a memory no one can steal." -- a headstone in Ireland

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "One day can bend your life." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Czeslaw Milosz
item.description: "Human reason is beautiful and invincible. No bars, no barbed wire, no pulping of books, No sentence of banishment can prevail against it. It puts what should be above things as they are. It does not know Jew from Greek nor slave from master." -- Czeslaw Milosz

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Josephine Hart
item.description: "Damaged people are dangerous. They know they can survive." -- Josephine Hart

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Mary McCarthy
item.description: "Life is a system of recurrent pairs, the poison and the antidote being eternally packaged together by some considerate heavenly druggist." -- Mary McCarthy

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Mary Doyle Curran
item.description: "An Irishman talks best when there is competition." -- Mary Doyle Curran

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Mary Deasy
item.description: "You may have noticed there are three things an Irishman always puts his soul in: his religion, his sports, and his politics. If you ever find an Irishman who is wishy-washy on any one of those, you can make up your mind to it he is not the true article at all." -- Mary Deasy

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Mary Deasy
item.description: "An Irish wedding is a tame thing to an Irish funeral." -- Mary Deasy

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Mary Deasy
item.description: "The Irish are never at peace but when they're fighting." -- Mary Deasy

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Clear communication between selves - the surface self and the deep self - is the enemy of self-doubt. It slays confusion." -- Stephen King

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Art is the concrete artifact of faith and expectation, the realization of a world that would otherwise be little more than a veil of pointless consciousness stretched over a gulf of mystery." -- Stephen King

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Jeremy Narby
item.description: "What if it were true that nature speaks in signs and that the secret to understanding its language consists in noticing similarities in shape or in form?" -- Jeremy Narby

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "They went to university because someone, at a time when universities seemed important, said that in order to rise in the world, you had to have a degree. And thus the world was deprived of some excellent gardeners, bakers, antique dealers, sculptors, and writers." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "You have understood what all great painters understand: in order to forget the rules, you must know them and respect them." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And the best way to know who we are is often to find out how others see us." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "What does learning mean: accumulating knowledge or transforming your life?" -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "In order for us to liberate the energy of our strength, our weakness must first have a chance to reveal itself." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "The nurse knew that those who really love, love in silence, with deeds and not with words." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "One loves truly only once in a lifetime, Julian, even if one isn’t aware of it." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Most of us have the good or bad fortune of seeing our lives fall apart so slowly we barely notice. " -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Time goes faster the more hollow it is. Lives with no meaning go straight past you, like trains that don’t stop at your station." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Bea says that the art of reading is slowly dying, that it's an intimate ritual, that a book is a mirror that offers us only what we already carry inside us, that when we read, we do it with all our heart and mind, and great readers are becoming more scarce by the day." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Lev Grossman
item.description: "The problem with growing up is that once you're grown up, the people who aren't grown up aren't fun anymore." -- Lev Grossman

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description:
"Alice laughed. 'There's no use trying,' she said. 'One can't believe impossible things.'
I daresay you haven't had much practice,' said the Queen. 'When I was your age, I always did it for half-an-hour a day. Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast. There goes the shawl again!" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Collin Shea add a quote by Margery Williams Bianco
item.description: "Generally, by the time you are Real, most of your hair has been loved off, and your eyes drop out and you get loose in the joints and very shabby. But these things don't matter at all, because once you are Real you can't be ugly, except to people who don't understand." -- Margery Williams Bianco
